document.title: Colorado Department of Education Computer Science Standards

739A0C3093F24C49A017AB831A458A9C.description: Research and abide by intellectual property laws and patents.

75F23C3F22D542C4AC9FCE05BD53F770.description:
Explore and integrate security measures such as encryption, authentication
and verification strategies to secure developed computer programs.

0CE3CA5EE3E5431994558213EAC0E9A2.description: Investigate and develop solutions that discourage online software piracy.

073CD4D50C60457E9C267E28C87C15D3.description: Describe how software licensing influences program development.

14CEC33374B342B8B36DAC32D6701028.description: Security and software licensing can present constraints and restrictions in computational design and development.

B8A4C8F265654512A34D6830A0C42F83.description:
Demonstrate ways to improve the accessibility of computational
technologies and artifacts.

68C1AB45364A420391A580F20819C41F.description:
Discuss and explain how diversity of design and issues of accessibility
impact a wide-range of users.

A7C504A341924A04B6FF57A29635D093.description:
Identify influential computing innovations, and identify the beneficial and
harmful effects they have had, or could have, on society, economy and
culture.

92F0EBAFB0454911848A6017F17349C0.description:
Identify and analyze current events to ensure the safety, security and well-
being of all potential clients and end users.

78DC3349326D4721A0FC43CA68831993.description:
Articulate the importance of securing personal data information on
encrypted storage systems.

AD8651D75FE444F99F1F96C84332C885.description: Investigate and understand privacy, security and protection laws.

624C5AD038814769B8CB219DB7C3E3AC.description: Computing solutions can have impacts (personal, ethical, social, economic and cultural) based on their use.

656A81E94D8E4D74B99724C94C2C30C0.description: Articulate lessons learned as a result of the design and creation process.

49F080BD14E64554B5EDCB8456AA9FFB.description: Create and share product support documentation for potential users.

DF254FB7B2DF40D3BE00180A5988D69A.description: Respond to feedback from clients to improve computing solutions.

E3EC0A4129804CEBA1DC90D4D9FB4AA4.description: Construct effective methods for gathering feedback from client.

21F3CAB6DBC54784A3C108432FF19C00.description:
Guide/advise clients on strategies and solutions best suited for their
problem (i.e., type of platform).

CC57D9A44AC2493F9DFF8B7A88177CCF.description: Understand and apply principles of client-based design.

0ED9FB99916740EAAD7303E26FD24EA0.description: Client-based design requirements and feedback are essential to a quality computational product or service.

E3DD7A9AB9B040C8BD6AF31ADF4447EA.description:
Determine when to use standard software tools like APIs, libraries, version
control repositories, etc.

588018E0865C4BD981A5F48EB13D177B.description:
Identify strategies such as peer reviews to test and refine artifacts in
development.

90381AEED31F495E89E5C9A875F44D94.description:
Identify and analyze a variety of collaborative tools (e.g., commenting,
development repositories) in order to determine the appropriateness for
intended use.

BC0A279CD55B443F8742B28CA5C48B41.description: Integrate collaborative strategies to improve programming outputs.

C8695C62ED774410900D1BA5D36DE389.description: Collaborative tools, methods and strategies can be used to design, develop and update computational artifacts.

38CDA6208B77471782D6C867E9DEEEA5.description: Create appropriate variables to store and retrieve data.

E61FBFE5B6C6470D8A74F6533700F3C5.description: Use various troubleshooting and debugging techniques to improve code.

8144FE58FC444375B93EC1D17B2C60FA.description:
Create code comments to communicate to other developers and ensure
documentation of code.

D6362A7E13654B14B0593C2792CF8ACE.description: The process of programming involves solving computational problems.

A62976EB824346CD950E4B34A58F99CC.description: Understand and apply core programming concepts.

188743FF8C60456CB6A384173D76B0C0.description: Determine and use graphical or text-based languages.

77955C9D630E4BC9B30596BFEB1D1559.description: Utilize tools and resources such as pseudocode, flowcharts, wireframes, etc., as part of the design process.

161ECDE3EF0645E68DCCB3C9FACCF6B1.description: Analyze and apply a design methodology to identify constraints and requirements of an identified problem.

9E3EF3C5837D4EC5B09B18FFCD51E6C5.description: The creation of a computer program requires a design process

02BB1CDFCE9A44DCB3660D6CCED1BEB3.description: Investigate different career pathways relating to systems security.

74B15F1D58974B8E8057A5BC0C1F8B5C.description:
Describe and compare methods to test/validate how well systems and data
are protected.

B3CA4F55FAD742D5BB26E2C6E2A52053.description:
Describe the process by which intruders gain entry into a production system
(e.g., reconnaissance).

E836DC90582542BF88137592C2C0A2E4.description: Identify examples of threats to systems and data.

3A1B0F007A2D40C78B84CEC2693C8B31.description: Robust computing systems require data protection.

8638AF263838449A8122CC3FA6332064.description:
Explain the ways an organization would continue to operate in light of a
systems failure.

6BC53AE21B944FDF9AE34EAB323C1EB2.description:
List the various backup methodologies (e.g., full, differential), and why one
would pick one over the other, or use all.

6FD9E1F9421345A6A16239D6197F23F2.description: Compare backup systems for computer users, or a network.

FE38C79A17C7407E9301CF0914305612.description: Describe elements of an effective backup system.

37FFC7975BA24A9E984CD5DFCFB0BA45.description: Identify different ways that systems might lose data or functionality.

3E581DE4495D4F898E10DA22E942F352.description: Robust computing systems require multiple methods of recovery.

BAEF10297D7D4054B0579C528095B0A0.description: Perform system analysis based on client considerations.

65C8EF4C079D42DA8C07BD5FD64FEF45.description: Illustrate options for considerations and develop conceptual model.

B70C3DFD79E34E3D86745559B2AE5FEB.description: Articulate design requirements back to client.

8909C09672E641C8A1D15044860A94A6.description: Summarize security approaches using a systems approach perspective.

4CA407530F1E43219D9E425958961C04.description: Explain the integration of hardware, software and network communications components to create a networked system.

D8EC551F672C4543837EE24CC8B5458C.description: Systems thinking is a way of holistically examining the various components and use cases that go into a given design.

30EA3CCCA28D480B8E5D5C0D683F5772.description: Describe how software interacts with hardware to complete tasks.

B74226FD1289469B849CA54AAF91F432.description: Explain what an operating system is, and why it is important for a computer or computing device (e.g., Linux, Windows, iOS).

A52CDE6B94DA4C989184B20DA321D900.description: Identify and differentiate between different kinds of software (e.g., operating systems vs. applications) and their purposes.

17A331C908344478971310DDACC217BD.description: Computer software is written for specific purposes.

8CCBA51FEFD14811B6865CBA0D4B1979.description:
Describe how computing devices are engineered for fault tolerance and
reliability, and identify potential sources of weakness (e.g., redundant power supplies, RAID, SAN/NAS connections).

4230B2195AE4499594A3A899778D3B4D.description:
Explain how to maintain safety when working on PCs, e.g., electromagnetic
precautions.

9EF79785BC204823A96F527A24608C06.description: List and explain the common working parts of a computing device.

9E00BC4B0F9A44FEBC1DFF2A4622E27C.description: Explain the difference between memory and disk storage, internal and external storage, Random Access Memory (RAM), flash, cloud.

FE526717D09D47C2ACAFBDDDD1E1DE64.description: Computer hardware, the lowest level of a computer system, consists of many different parts, each providing a specialized function.

3AB58815850E43B191AF30897060153A.description: Explain the difference between decimal, hexadecimal, octal and binary number formats and how they are used in computing environments.

C61569BE59BE495D9A81B23C76C2F3CD.description: Illustrate and describe the basic components and various network types and topologies (e.g., personal, local, metropolitan, and wide).

08BA9C3B8C754AC3846EDEDAE6E4C4CF.description: Describe key protocols and underlying processes of internet-based services, (e.g., https) and discuss impact of technology change on communication protocols.

AF9C16FFE0784BEAAADA1D84C1A0F503.description: Communication between computers (and over the internet) can be configured in many different ways and consist of several hardware and software components.

09AF89A6E02D4C75A4FB43EE9CE0D23C.description: Provide multiple versions of data visualization in order to deepen problem analysis.

99F305956A194849A1810BB0EA57CEE9.description: Design visualizations using the appropriate tool(s) with the end user in mind.

DE9EA812991645FDA0C8E9976AC5053A.description: Analyze computer output in different forms (e.g., plain text, CSV, graphs, images).

F147876E5446446393BB194618A81058.description: Data from a computer program can be visually presented to better understand and articulate solutions to a problem.

666924AD383E464AAEC0EF9DB0BF1AB1.description: Interpret and analyze data to make informed decisions.

3A3B55F92B7549189C55AB616AC91599.description:
Provide multiple versions of data visualization in order to deepen problem
analysis.

A092254EAF5341939441AECA9BD97E5C.description: Analyze computer programs to identify patterns within the program.

0664415AE0444580A03AC5E23D660D01.description: Many problems appropriate for solving with a computer are organized around patterns.

9B3958655E484077BFCB382F0D34B353.description: Compare and contrast various data structures/techniques for storing and processing data (e.g., arrays, lists, tables).

57BD9E433CC74ADA9F0542F788E49741.description: Evaluate the trade-offs for how data elements are organized and where data are stored (e.g., PNG/GIF, structured/unstructured).

6803E1DD03764667AFEDE109E0814370.description: Represent data using multiple encoding schemes (e.g., RGB, Hex, HSB, ASCII, Unicode).

4936CC75C908430781CA6ABD4D603BD6.description: Identify different types of data that are exchanged and produced by computers (e.g., protocols).

8DF398A37FB64BA1B933D0659BB969AF.description: Data can be represented in different ways for storage and exchange.

9301C6A8B7F641BB870DCFA3AFD6CF36.description: Demonstrate different ways to represent key problem components.

9A9904FBF2734AB1B311470D1A51F9A4.description:
Identify and prioritize the most relevant parts of a problem while filtering
out extraneous details.

678883C07F9E4DA8BDF1959DF71B51D5.description: Describe how abstraction is central to computational thinking.

57620B58C6CB45E0BBBBDBDF50DD25AE.description: Abstraction is used to reduce complexity of larger problems by focusing on main ideas.

E8D19E7C6D9C4B479CE9C95B9D591441.description: Formulate possible solutions based on the decomposition of a problem.

F55B29CD941A4CF4831A1BB3B3232AD5.description: Demonstrate how the process of decomposition is iterative and used to solve problems.

96961E466DAE4406AF580C3D57E9F646.description: Large, complex problems can be broken down into smaller, more manageable components.

43C706C22486435EBB3A91DE72C94136.description: Test and troubleshoot so that algorithms produce reasonable results.

6CDD7E09671F4A6ABF8983297ED7E8EC.description: Use an iterative approach to developing an algorithm.

BB0687207D98492DB927B8FC5A71A454.description: Describe pros and cons of the performance of algorithms for the same task.

BAA9C8DFD4A3430797937E88B32108B6.description: Algorithm development and use is an ongoing process that involves adapting, critiquing and troubleshooting programs and/or processes.

F84D2F8EC0D84983AF86A17F5D05AEAF.description:
Use multiple methods to represent an algorithm (e.g., diagram,
programming language, unplugged).

1F7BF525EE494148865FA4CAAFA679F3.description:
Adapt algorithms used in one problem to solve a related or different
problem.

8485501523A84D31B9CD9A4DC9A96EDE.description: Explain the value of heuristic algorithms to model ways to solve problems.

2F723A49679948E6AA36A66E9B1CE9F3.description: Illustrate the flow of execution of an iterative algorithm (e.g., recursion).

464729AE1AFC44AC8476F87E5F3C3EF3.description: Identify and compare different algorithms that can be used to solve the same problem.

CCB137F6BC87490A8F210E84855160F1.description: Algorithms can be represented and used in different ways (e.g., languages, diagrams, pseudocode).

215CD949F60046DFAD8183194BCA8CDF.description: Identify and describe algorithms that exist within their personal lives.

C2161B1E2758487CAE984FCBF6BC247B.description: Recognize problems that cannot be solved computationally.

BDC583C40336473888DF716FC9381806.description: Use an iterative approach to utilizing and/or developing an algorithm.

C85A4C106ADB48D1B1B82AE4AD8C5C61.description: Use an algorithm that involves mathematical operations and functions to solve problems.

288FA7194F4644B9AEB70D0AC56B528B.description: Create or adapt algorithms to solve problems for multiple purposes (e.g., personal interests, client needs).

F5A030FFF89F4FBF87C90E08470F0C37.description: Predict the outcome of different types of algorithms.

87B42ED9D6044D79849015974CD8560E.description: Identify and create different types of algorithms (sort, search, etc.).

44765D80EA984D94BEF85FAC08DF6610.description: Computational thinking is used to create algorithmic solutions to real-world problems.
